p: Second, our results add evidence to the wider literature on the occurrence of measles predominantly among unvaccinated individuals [ 8, 11, 23, 28, 35]. This confirms that immunization against measles, with the current live-attenuated vaccine, represents the most effective preventive measure to control the spread of the disease in the general population and also providing good protection irrespective the remarkable genetic variability of circulating MVs [ 36].
